Solidity

Solidity is an object-oriented, high-level language for implementing smart contracts. Smart contracts are programs which govern the behaviour of accounts within the Ethereum state.

# 

<span key="4e9fe030c9974e068f06e088758d1cec"><span offset-key="4e9fe030c9974e068f06e088758d1cec:0">IDE (to practice with)</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1rvnzad" />

<span key="1d170a796578462398150a234ebfacbd"><span offset-key="1d170a796578462398150a234ebfacbd:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

# 

<span key="ef1637dd574446b886fc0cbb21f33008"><span offset-key="ef1637dd574446b886fc0cbb21f33008:0">Solidity</span></span>

<span key="f9cd4f2de53742edb4add0e09c48597f"><span offset-key="f9cd4f2de53742edb4add0e09c48597f:0">Solidity is an object-oriented, high-level language for implementing smart contracts. Smart contracts are programs which govern the behaviour of accounts within the Ethereum state.</span></span>

<span key="348b7c1459644835984f9dd7ae4ba3ba"><span offset-key="348b7c1459644835984f9dd7ae4ba3ba:0">Solidity is a </span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_programming_languages_by_type#Curly-bracket_languages" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="5f0e0e276ecc483cb2d1462b0ceba4d8" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-64280_259-64281-237__"><span data-key="ac294565b9524abb9044ec401bdf8c17"><span data-offset-key="ac294565b9524abb9044ec401bdf8c17:0">curly-bracket language</span></span></span></a><span key="4b10e797b1dd42ac8aa11a14049a8cbf"><span offset-key="4b10e797b1dd42ac8aa11a14049a8cbf:0">. It is influenced by C++, Python and JavaScript, and is designed to target the Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM). You can find more details about which languages Solidity has been inspired by in the </span></span><a href="https://docs.soliditylang.org/en/v0.8.7/language-influences.html" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="148142d01be84e578f20e8ad4fe3e9e1" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-64280_259-64281-237__"><span data-key="f9726985cc8346eaa18a5e66069bfcdd"><span data-offset-key="f9726985cc8346eaa18a5e66069bfcdd:0">language influences</span></span></span></a><span key="4962425ce0734ac9bde7c10f52e2e722"><span offset-key="4962425ce0734ac9bde7c10f52e2e722:0"> section.</span></span>

<span key="28b42de0cc7b437bb01310641369b927"><span offset-key="28b42de0cc7b437bb01310641369b927:0">Solidity is statically typed, supports inheritance, libraries and complex user-defined types among other features.</span></span>

<span key="958ec84df4c842ddab7a92bfc129d325"><span offset-key="958ec84df4c842ddab7a92bfc129d325:0">With Solidity you can create contracts for uses such as voting, crowdfunding, blind auctions, and multi-signature wallets.</span></span>

<span key="3fdde2ffeac54ac8b6168990244fca9d"><span offset-key="3fdde2ffeac54ac8b6168990244fca9d:0">When deploying contracts, you should use the latest released version of Solidity. This is because breaking changes as well as new features and bug fixes are introduced regularly. We currently use a 0.x version number </span></span><a href="https://semver.org/#spec-item-4" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="84510a237df2440790e6bf29fd0cae67" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-64280_259-64281-237__"><span data-key="f6620920d95b4359a0fe0a810aaf0766"><span data-offset-key="f6620920d95b4359a0fe0a810aaf0766:0">to indicate this fast pace of change</span></span></span></a><span key="ec9d74de0e12409bbe80af4a6e1bed88"><span offset-key="ec9d74de0e12409bbe80af4a6e1bed88:0">.</span></span>

<span key="e9eb9a588de04a878643fc164d9a4411"><span offset-key="e9eb9a588de04a878643fc164d9a4411:0">Warning</span></span>

<span key="756031048d2c4f16b045f82f6e295f70"><span offset-key="756031048d2c4f16b045f82f6e295f70:0">Solidity recently released the 0.8.x version that introduced a lot of breaking changes. Make sure you read </span></span><a href="https://docs.soliditylang.org/en/v0.8.7/080-breaking-changes.html" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="44b4f688b4784c09ba177bbabcfb9d85" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-64280_259-64281-237__"><span data-key="cec89fa5ca4a42a6b7e96de0f1d269af"><span data-offset-key="cec89fa5ca4a42a6b7e96de0f1d269af:0">the full list</span></span></span></a><span key="8837534f998b4138b0d926f7b5ff08d6"><span offset-key="8837534f998b4138b0d926f7b5ff08d6:0">.</span></span>

<span key="38c4cc41b5464386a170295dd3add3f8"><span offset-key="38c4cc41b5464386a170295dd3add3f8:0">Ideas for improving Solidity or this documentation are always welcome, read our </span></span><a href="https://docs.soliditylang.org/en/v0.8.7/contributing.html" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="24902eaa66734a019e11e055a432144c" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-64280_259-64281-237__"><span data-key="a2418538036e4bb7bcd38a86f54f06a6"><span data-offset-key="a2418538036e4bb7bcd38a86f54f06a6:0">contributors guide</span></span></span></a><span key="9bb66fb4342e4663b7f9b5b4e4fe210f"><span offset-key="9bb66fb4342e4663b7f9b5b4e4fe210f:0"> for more details.</span></span>

## 

<span key="221e5b60ece34916942c94ae04b18c32"><span offset-key="221e5b60ece34916942c94ae04b18c32:0">Getting Started</span></span>

<span key="4a0050bf0e9e45b7a7a24dd99c2df764">**1. Understand the Smart Contract Basics**</span>

<span key="09886d3a5a354efe94b6eabe8d801c90"><span offset-key="09886d3a5a354efe94b6eabe8d801c90:0">If you are new to the concept of smart contracts we recommend you to get started by digging into the “Introduction to Smart Contracts” section, which covers:</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="4b4323a5076e4cbd9164a0d5ae3656b2"><span offset-key="4b4323a5076e4cbd9164a0d5ae3656b2:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://docs.soliditylang.org/en/v0.8.7/introduction-to-smart-contracts.html#simple-smart-contract" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="d6dde5de64ed4a46ad02018e3bd1143b" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-64280_259-64281-237__"><span data-key="3c5f4cdedfb44c0abb0efc74f32675eb"><span data-offset-key="3c5f4cdedfb44c0abb0efc74f32675eb:0">A simple example smart contract</span></span></span></a><span key="ae1a368a93b843c5b351aa0ebd5dbad5"><span offset-key="ae1a368a93b843c5b351aa0ebd5dbad5:0"> written in Solidity.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="9b47c35dd577444e959807c6efbb6526"><span offset-key="9b47c35dd577444e959807c6efbb6526:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://docs.soliditylang.org/en/v0.8.7/introduction-to-smart-contracts.html#blockchain-basics" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="6b9cababd3ff4f378a26421a74474210" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-64280_259-64281-237__"><span data-key="43eae9e59dfc4c2fbd36c96cc816d94a"><span data-offset-key="43eae9e59dfc4c2fbd36c96cc816d94a:0">Blockchain Basics</span></span></span></a><span key="9156fd8dadce427eb9fe3866f9db5e81"><span offset-key="9156fd8dadce427eb9fe3866f9db5e81:0">.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="d9bb550a4a514f3b83db5c272c58b2fb"><span offset-key="d9bb550a4a514f3b83db5c272c58b2fb:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://docs.soliditylang.org/en/v0.8.7/introduction-to-smart-contracts.html#the-ethereum-virtual-machine" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="3dfbaba10a4b4d89a6711bbdbf5f98c1" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-64280_259-64281-237__"><span data-key="040bdfbb6a314da0b1863ddb7bf18d67"><span data-offset-key="040bdfbb6a314da0b1863ddb7bf18d67:0">The Ethereum Virtual Machine</span></span></span></a><span key="7b3c146b7241405f95f17185faf3c474"><span offset-key="7b3c146b7241405f95f17185faf3c474:0">.</span></span>

<span key="9fd11e5241814df29a4cc66b1bf26bd7">**2. Get to Know Solidity**</span>

<span key="75ec1d06ccb2477e9f4076ad4728f252"><span offset-key="75ec1d06ccb2477e9f4076ad4728f252:0">Once you are accustomed to the basics, we recommend you read the </span></span><a href="https://docs.soliditylang.org/en/v0.8.7/solidity-by-example.html" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="62105eb9530e47b68668184ef189629b" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-64280_259-64281-237__"><span data-key="2daa47f4e81347ddbfe964c64ec3a50e"><span data-offset-key="2daa47f4e81347ddbfe964c64ec3a50e:0">“Solidity by Example”</span></span></span></a><span key="06d664c7c6c94f899d906c6082929d5e"><span offset-key="06d664c7c6c94f899d906c6082929d5e:0"> and “Language Description” sections to understand the core concepts of the language.</span></span>

<span key="4cba6c29c54b4db084c05cb6e4195c12">**3. Install the Solidity Compiler**</span>

<span key="e32544e82b6c4df0b5bad2f99f867dfe"><span offset-key="e32544e82b6c4df0b5bad2f99f867dfe:0">There are various ways to install the Solidity compiler, simply choose your preferred option and follow the steps outlined on the </span></span><a href="https://docs.soliditylang.org/en/v0.8.7/installing-solidity.html#installing-solidity" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="a29919eea9154b8386c451ee1fddfd7d" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-64280_259-64281-237__"><span data-key="db53e2bcb15d4b6eaa4ef2a612d3e6dc"><span data-offset-key="db53e2bcb15d4b6eaa4ef2a612d3e6dc:0">installation page</span></span></span></a><span key="6e89b5160bea40cf9a81861957d4e1be"><span offset-key="6e89b5160bea40cf9a81861957d4e1be:0">.</span></span>

<span key="05b5f41a159c4fc090f0b8767017566c"><span offset-key="05b5f41a159c4fc090f0b8767017566c:0">Hint</span></span>

<span key="fbc29050c58e4f70a666e7caebb11278"><span offset-key="fbc29050c58e4f70a666e7caebb11278:0">You can try out code examples directly in your browser with the </span></span><a href="https://remix.ethereum.org" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="88af11fbda564986ba2ead7df35fec0b" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-64280_259-64281-237__"><span data-key="f5b4b0d08cb34cee9599d433d72da190"><span data-offset-key="f5b4b0d08cb34cee9599d433d72da190:0">Remix IDE</span></span></span></a><span key="7eb89310f5d2419086e34dd65a02720c"><span offset-key="7eb89310f5d2419086e34dd65a02720c:0">. Remix is a web browser based IDE that allows you to write, deploy and administer Solidity smart contracts, without the need to install Solidity locally.</span></span>

<span key="6b435505b1264b9d889ec9ce3ef47a1c"><span offset-key="6b435505b1264b9d889ec9ce3ef47a1c:0">W</span></span>

<span key="1fa41d5d015c48d0a3983c1ed239f4ce"><span offset-key="1fa41d5d015c48d0a3983c1ed239f4ce:0">As humans write software, it can have bugs. You should follow established software development best-practices when writing your smart contracts. This includes code review, testing, audits, and correctness proofs. Smart contract users are sometimes more confident with code than their authors, and blockchains and smart contracts have their own unique issues to watch out for, so before working on production code, make sure you read the </span></span><a href="https://docs.soliditylang.org/en/v0.8.7/security-considerations.html#security-considerations" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="c4b396b08fde40d3a73759f9cdff89ad" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-64280_259-64281-237__"><span data-key="700bc3bc242a4ecb9a36b73a221e48d0"><span data-offset-key="700bc3bc242a4ecb9a36b73a221e48d0:0">Security Considerations</span></span></span></a><span key="92efe56432964cdc982324c9363812bd"><span offset-key="92efe56432964cdc982324c9363812bd:0"> section.</span></span>

<span key="5e540520bcfe415a9ad5fae50bc6f3d0">**4. Learn More**</span>

<span key="eeaf28ef5d054dc987358c892e547cf6"><span offset-key="eeaf28ef5d054dc987358c892e547cf6:0">If you want to learn more about building decentralized applications on Ethereum, the </span></span><a href="https://ethereum.org/en/developers/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="f6568a1fb55942c681b3685b48ca87b9" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-64280_259-64281-237__"><span data-key="9ddfd145eff3434aaeb32f7b41453b1d"><span data-offset-key="9ddfd145eff3434aaeb32f7b41453b1d:0">Ethereum Developer Resources</span></span></span></a><span key="9984f5ae03754ae38fd18782f128a975"><span offset-key="9984f5ae03754ae38fd18782f128a975:0"> can help you with further general documentation around Ethereum, and a wide selection of tutorials, tools and development frameworks.</span></span>

<span key="840be27be3574ebea6e3a52496800cc2"><span offset-key="840be27be3574ebea6e3a52496800cc2:0">If you have any questions, you can try searching for answers or asking on the </span></span><a href="https://ethereum.stackexchange.com" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="0e35b4bae65e4ddca68656fb0fefa042" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-64280_259-64281-237__"><span data-key="ac7fe15f88d74c1dadf4f6d9aae940bd"><span data-offset-key="ac7fe15f88d74c1dadf4f6d9aae940bd:0">Ethereum StackExchange</span></span></span></a><span key="28ab201c455c4d6e942a99f04e165abc"><span offset-key="28ab201c455c4d6e942a99f04e165abc:0">, or our </span></span><a href="https://gitter.im/ethereum/solidity/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="8556cd085242458a95fe5bacc3446880" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-64280_259-64281-237__"><span data-key="7afb5abcb7a2401396361e7878ea7373"><span data-offset-key="7afb5abcb7a2401396361e7878ea7373:0">Gitter channel</span></span></span></a><span key="1efa410ae8fd4d2e9b2dda877e0d46b1"><span offset-key="1efa410ae8fd4d2e9b2dda877e0d46b1:0">.</span></span>

<span key="6c9fcc6b37344cf4b029ce0e283997d2"><span offset-key="6c9fcc6b37344cf4b029ce0e283997d2:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>
